title: How to Change the Video Autoplay Settings on Twitter

steps.title: Log in to X
steps.content: Log in to X . Go to www.twitter.com and sign in with your password and username. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the ⋯ More button, on the left menu panel.
steps.content: Click on the ⋯ More button, on the left menu panel. A drop-down menu will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Settings and Privacy.
steps.content: Select Settings and Privacy . You can also use the following link to quickly access the settings page: www.twitter.com/settings/account [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Data usage settings.
steps.content: Open the Data usage settings . Move to the “General” section and click on the Data usage option.

steps.title: Turn on or off the video autoplay.
steps.content: Turn on or off the video autoplay. Click on the Autoplay text and select your preferred option. If you want to disable the video autoplay feature, select “Never” from the options. This setting will also apply to GIFs.

steps.title: Browse X.
steps.content: Browse X . If you have turned off the autoplay feature, you have to click on the blue coloured play button every time to view a video on X.
